title: Buyer 1
description:
Job Summary

Negotiates pricing, facilitates purchases, and coordinates all activities required to purchase parts and a NMEX . Locates and develops suppliers that can meet current and future production or non-production parts requirements. Ensures suppliers meet Nissan's goals for quality, cost and delivery. Coordinates with other departments to ensure an uninterrupted supply of parts to production lines and to solve supply problems. Maintains daily business support activities of department administrative support personnel.

B. Job Responsibilities

Negotiates and establishes commodity prices for production parts. Handles assigned commodities. Ensures cost control, achieve plan cost reduction goals and requirements. Ensures suppliers meet Nissan's goals for quality, cost and delivery. Performs comparative analysis of competing suppliers to select most competitive source for a specified commodity. Establishes contracts for assigned commodities; maintains purchase orders, and related purchasing records; maintains files and records of current and potential suppliers, materials and prices. Coordinates activities between all departments and supplier base to ensure uninterrupted supply of parts and resolution of supply issues and problems. Plans, develops, implements and maintains cost reduction plans in support of the department's cost reduction goals.

As necessary, performs other related duties of which the above are representative.

Language: Excellent English verbal and written communication skills. Fully bilingual.  Years of Experience:

1-2 years experience on Purchasing or related areas

 Education

Provides financial performance analysis for monthly financial reviews. Identifies and proposes immediate and long-term changes to CV programs and policies to drive meaningful improvements and innovation based on financial and program data analysis. Reviews, processes, or approves daily transactions or requests for analysis as needed. Supports other CV initiatives affecting the organization as requested.

Primary liaison between Corporate Vehicles and both NMAC and NNA Finance. Assists CV Managers with the development of annual OPEX and CAPEX budget plans and forecasts as requested by Finance. Handles all month-end close activities including monthly accrual preparation, intercompany billings, departmental re-class journal entries, and dealer related CV transactions. Supervises the submission of all Payroll related CV files/transactions. Provides financial performance analysis for monthly Corporate Vehicle financial reviews. Develops necessary documentation to support expenditure requests, submits shopping baskets, and ensures purchase orders are issued in a timely manner. Understands basic accounting rules to ensure that operational invoices are properly coded and provides guidance to ensure expenditures are properly classified. Develops ad hoc and standard reporting as requested by the Corporate Vehicles leadership team. Creates standard dashboards to be utilized by all levels of management to create a better understanding of CV Financials, Operations, and Customer Satisfaction. Able to interpret the data in a meaningful way for understanding outside immediate department. Works closely with CV management team on ad hoc projects and helps maintain close cohesive working relationship with the chosen partners and internal Nissan/Infiniti operations departments (including, but not limited to - Payroll, Tax, Risk Management, Vehicle Operations, Legal, Accounting) through continuous communication/collaboration to identify and determine appropriate workloads. Suggests system updates for improved efficiency. Assists in testing, troubleshooting, and providing training on the CV Fleet Management System and ensure that it meets the needs of the organization. Supports and leads CV Point of Sale and Fuel Card programs by managing customer issues, performing detailed audits, and quality assurance checks. Recommends strategies to resolve operational issues. As necessary, provides additional and other related financial planning and analysis support as needed.

Excellent customer service skills, understanding of financial and budgeting principles and practices, Excellent analytical, writing, networking, and organizational skills. Good interpersonal and presentation skills. Good problem solving, conflict resolution and project management skills. Professional demeanor with strong leadership, planning, organization, negotiation and analytical skills.

Broad understanding of fleet management and broad knowledge of supported business operations and functions.

Years of Experience:

Three or more years of professional level experience to include finance related functions and data analytics. Experience in financial planning and analysis, accounting, and/or related discipline. Excellent problem-solving skills and customer service orientation. Excellent analytic, presentation, interpersonal, and organization skills. Ability to perform in a fast-paced, dynamic, deadline, and detail-driven environment. 

Education

Bachelor's degree (or higher) in Finance, Economics, Accounting.

Languages

Advance or Upper intermediate English level.

Specific Course/Certifications

Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office applications including Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, other PC applications, or mainframe applications to create specialized applications. Experience with SAP and analytical tools (i.e. Access, Tableau, SQL, etc.) preferred.
